input_text:
Job Title: Plant Engineer

Location: Batavia, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Engineering, Manufacturing

Description:
LHH Recruitment Solutions has partnered with a growing organization, and they are seeking a Plant Engineer to join their team in Batavia, IL. The Plant Engineer will collaborate closely with the Plant Manager to ensure the plant's operations are compliant with safety regulations, maintain high-quality standards, and optimize costs. The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Engineering or Construction Management and demonstrate proficiency in MS Office products. Competitive Salary and Benefits Package (PTO, Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance) are offered. 
Key Responsibilities:with the Plant Manager to develop and implement strategies to ensure compliance with safety regulations, quality standards, and cost optimization goals.regular inspections and audits of plant facilities and equipment to identify potential safety hazards, quality issues, and cost-saving opportunities.and maintain documentation related to safety procedures, quality control protocols, and cost-saving initiatives.plant operations and processes to identify areas for improvement in safety, quality, and cost efficiency.closely with cross-functional teams to implement process improvements and address issues related to safety, quality, and cost.technical expertise and support for plant projects, including equipment upgrades, installations, and modifications.and track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to safety, quality, and cost to evaluate plant performance and identify areas for improvement.with suppliers and vendors to source materials and equipment, negotiate contracts, and ensure cost-effectiveness.updated on industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to plant engineering, safety, and quality management.
Qualifications and Skills:Degree in Industrial Engineering, Construction Management, or related field required.experience or internship as a plant engineer, industrial engineer, or manufacturing engineer.in MS Office products, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex data and identify actionable insights.communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.with a strong commitment to safety, quality, and cost optimization.to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.of regulatory requirements and best practices related to safety, quality, and cost management in a manufacturing environment.
If you are a passionate Plant Engineer looking for a new and rewarding career, please apply today! You don’t want to miss out on this opportunity! 
LHH is a leader in permanent recruitment—and in the placement of top talent. Our areas of specialty include office administration, customer service, human resources, and supply chain and logistics. Please feel to check us out and apply for other opportunities if this role isn’t a perfect match.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please visit https://www.lhh.com/candidate-privacy/

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Plant Engineer
output_json.summary: LHH Recruitment Solutions has partnered with a growing organization seeking a Plant Engineer to join their team in Batavia, IL.
job_responsibilities: Collaborate with the Plant Manager to develop and implement strategies for compliance with safety regulations, quality standards, and cost optimization goals.
Conduct regular inspections and audits of plant facilities and equipment to identify potential safety hazards, quality issues, and cost-saving opportunities.
Maintain documentation related to safety procedures, quality control protocols, and cost-saving initiatives.
Identify areas for improvement in safety, quality, and cost efficiency in plant operations and processes.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to implement process improvements and address issues related to safety, quality, and cost.
Provide technical expertise and support for plant projects, including equipment upgrades, installations, and modifications.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to safety, quality, and cost to evaluate plant performance and identify areas for improvement.
Negotiate contracts with suppliers and vendors to ensure cost-effectiveness.
Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to plant engineering, safety, and quality management.
